Key Match Events: India were 47 for 2 in 6.5 overs in chase of 140 when rain interrupted the game and eventually forced it to be called off.
Jasprit Bumrah won the toss and opted to bowl first in the game.
Barry McCarthy scored 51 not out off 33 balls.
Ravi Bishnoi (2 for 23) and Jasprit Bumrah (2 for 24) shone with two wickets apiece as India restricted Ireland to 139 for 7 in 20 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: India skipper Jasprit Bumrah won the toss and opted to bowl first in the game.
Paul Stirling said, 'Looking forward to going out there. We have had a good run in Scotland, let's see what we can show today. This is the beginning of the road to 2024 and the World Cup.'

Jasprit Bumrah said, 'We'll bowl first, very happy to be here. The weather looks lovely. I feel good, looking forward to play some cricket. You realise what you were missing, very happy to be back. We expect nothing short of a fight from Ireland. As a fast bowler, I hope the pitch does something. We have two debuts - Rinku and Prasidh Krishna. Told them to just enjoy their cricket.'
Post-Match Reflections: India beat Ireland by two runs via DLS method to take a 1-0 lead in the three-match series in Dublin on Friday.
The game went into 15 overs before a decisive wicket by Jasprit Bumrah led to the Irish team being all out for 139.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted the game and eventually forced it to be called off.
India's chase was halted when rain interrupted the game and the match was called off.
